thread.title: Deon Newsome charged with DWI and public intoxication, suspended from team
thread.title_full: Deon Newsome charged with DWI and public intoxication, suspended from team

author: Nolan Knight, sports staff writer
title: Deon Newsome charged with DWI and public intoxication, suspended from team
text:
Wide receiver Deon Newsome (20) is tackled by the Cavalier's Ryan Santoro (8). Posted: Monday, October 19, 2015 1:24 pm Deon Newsome charged with DWI and public intoxication, suspended from team Nolan Knight, sports staff writer   0 comments 
Virginia Tech wide receiver Deon Newsome was booked in the Montgomery County Regional Jail early morning Sunday Oct. 18. He is indefinitely suspended from play but can still practice with the team. 
According to jail reports, Newsome, 20, was charged with driving while intoxicated (class 1 misdemeanor) and public intoxication (class 4 misdemeanor). He was bonded out later in the day. 
Deon Newsome was a redshirt sophomore receiver for the Hokies, although he was not being used much this season on the offensive side of the field. He played in 12 games last season. 
This is Newsome's second suspension from the team, in just a 12-month span. The 5-foot-11, 187-pound receiver was suspended from the team last year for the Military Bowl for an unspecified violation of team rules.
